short_summary: Purchase, delivery, and installation of office furniture to Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island, in phases, between March 2024 and February 2025
description: Amendment 05 is raised to amend the answer to questions 10.\\n All other terms and conditions remain the same.\\n ***************************************\\n \\n Amendment 04 is raised to answer questions 9 & 10.\\n \\n All other terms and conditions remain the same.\\n ***************************************\\n \\n Amendment 03 is raised to answer questions 7 & 8 and to insert modifications to Cat3, Items 17 & 19 and to the delivery & installation Items 22 & 24 highlighted in yellow.\\n \\n All other terms and conditions remain the same.\\n ***************************************\\n \\n Amendment 02 is raised to answer questions 3, 4, 5 & 6.\\n \\n All other terms and conditions remain the same.\\n ***************************************\\n \\n Amendment 01 is raised to answer questions 1 & 2.\\n \\n All other terms and conditions remain the same.\\n ***************************************\\n \\n Notice of Proposed Procurement (NPP) Template\\n \\n 1. This NPP is issued pursuant to PWGSC Supply Arrangement (SA) # E60PQ-140003/C and covers a requirement from the following Product Category(ies) of the SA: \\n - Product Category 2 - Freestanding Height Adjustable Desk/Table Products;\\n - Product Category 3 - Metal Filing and Storage Cabinets;\\n - Product Category 5 - Ancillary and Lighting Products\\n - Product Category 6 – Support Space – Collaborative Furniture\\n - This requirement also contains products that are NON-SUPPLY ARRANGEMENT.\\n\\n2. Employment and Social Development Canada has a requirement for the purchase, delivery and installation of office furniture to Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island in phases, between March 2024 to February 2025 (consult the bid solicitation document).\\n\\n3. This NPP covers a requirement to be solicited among the PSIB stream of Suppliers (SA holders).\\n\\n4. This procurement is set aside under the federal government’s Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business. This procurement is set aside from the international trade agreements under the provision each has for set-asides for small and minority businesses. Further to Article 800 of the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), CFTA does not apply to this procurement.\\n\\n5. There is a security requirement associated with the requirement. For additional information, consult the bid solicitation document\\n\\n
full_summary:
### Furniture Tender Notice (Expired)

**Tender ID:** `cb-7-79275772`
**Solicitation ID:** `100024571/A`
**Tender Closing Date:** November 29, 2023, 14:00:00

**Procurement Overview:**

The Employment and Social Development Canada (ESDC) is seeking bidders to supply office furniture, delivering to Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island, in phases between March 2024 to February 2025. The project pertains to the federal government's Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business, excluding international trade agreements.

**Products and Services:**

The procurement includes products from the following Product Categories:

*   Product Category 2: Height Adjustable Desk/Table Products
*   Product Category 3: Metal Filing and Storage Cabinets
*   Product Category 5: Ancillary and Lighting Products
*   Product Category 6: Support Space – Collaborative Furniture

A security requirement is associated with the requirement, as stated in the bid solicitation document.

**Tendering Process:**

This procurement is set aside under the federal government's Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business, and is open for competitive bidding. Bidders can register their interest and request the solicitation document from the Canadian Government's procurement website.

**Important Correspondence Information:**

For additional information or to request the solicitation document, please contact the designated officer Eric Potvin at:

`eric.potvin@hrsdc-rhdcc.gc.ca`

tel: `(819) 431-9917`

fax: `None`

### Attachments

The following documents are available in English and French:

*   Annex E (RFB)
*   Questions and Answers (QA) documents 1 to 10 (available in both English and French)
*   Bid Solicitation Document

For more information or to register interest, please visit the Canadian Government's procurement website. [www.canadabuys.ca](http://www.canadabuys.ca)
###  

### Tender Description:



The notice below contains an Amendment Notice "1". 



 Amended clauses were made to reconcile relevant 

section changes to WI 243.13 of the Public Works and Government Services Canada Procurement Instruments and contracts Manual If you have any objections to Annex E - RFB, please submit your comments to Central contracting by email to: serve-avis@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca.



### PCAP-R Framework
